page.title: 02Arts and Crafts in Alford
page.content: Craft-type hobbies have always been popular,nurtured partly by the Scottish Women's Rural Institute's policy of encouraging these skills. Alford Academy houses evening classes in fly-tying,upholstery and crafts.The opening of The Hobby Shop and studio in Alford this summer was an exciting event solving shopping problems and providing an opportunity to try out new crafts.Day and evening classes and day schools are held there in basic drawing and painting, lace-making, canvas embroidery, china painting, weaving, spinning and so on. The Domesday project has led to a group of women and children making an Alford Tapestry each making a 6" square depicting life on Donside. This will be assembled and hung in the I.T. Centre.
